channel.title: Organ music of the centuries
channel.description:
Highlights of noted organ music selections from various periods, including Pre-Baroque and Baroque; Classical and Romantic; and Modern.

An online collection of early educational public radio content from the National Association of Educational Broadcasters (NAEB).

item.title: Classical and Romantic organ music, part three
item.description: This program presents performances of organ compositions by Cesar Franck and Charles Widor.
item.dc:creator: Sears, Ralph
item.dc:subject: Widor, Charles-Marie, 1844-1937. Organ music

item.title: Pre-Baroque and Baroque organ music, part seven
item.description: This program features more performances of organ compositions by Johann Sebastian Bach.
item.dc:creator: Sears, Ralph
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Modern organ music, part three
item.description: This program presents performances of organ compositions by Seth Bingham; Percy Whitlock; and Joseph Jongen.
item.dc:creator: Sears, Ralph
item.dc:subject: Whitlock, Percy, 1903-1946. Organ music. Selections

item.title: Classical and Romantic organ music, part four
item.description: This program presents more performances of organ compositions by Cesar Franck.
item.dc:creator: Sears, Ralph
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Modern organ music, part two
item.description: This program presents performances of organ compositions by Darius Milhaud; Percy Whitlock; and Flor Peeters.
item.dc:creator: Sears, Ralph
item.dc:subject: Whitlock, Percy, 1903-1946. Organ music. Selections

item.title: Modern organ music, part six
item.description: This program presents performances of organ compositions by Jean Langlais, Maurice Durufle; and Marcel Dupre.

item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Modern organ music, part one
item.description: This program presents performances of organ compositions by Joseph Jongen; Leo Sowerby; and Ralph Vaughan Williams.
item.dc:creator: Sears, Ralph
item.dc:subject: Vaughan Williams, Ralph, 1872-1958

item.title: Modern organ music, part five
item.description: This program presents performances of organ compositions by Edward Bairstow, Seth Bingham; Leo Sowerby; and Joseph Jongen.

item.dc:subject: Sowerby, Leo, 1895-1968. Organ music. Selections

item.title: Classical and Romantic organ music, part six
item.description: This program presents performances of organ compositions by Felix Mendelssohn; Johannes Brahms and Max Reger.

item.dc:subject: Reger, Max, 1873-1916. Organ music

item.title: Pre-Baroque and Baroque organ music, part eight
item.description: This program features more performances of organ compositions by Johann Sebastian Bach.
item.dc:creator: Sears, Ralph
item.dc:subject: Performing Arts

item.title: Pre-Baroque and Baroque organ music, part three
item.description: This program features performances of organ compositions by Byrd; Henry Purcell; Daquin; Couperin; Clerembault; Johan Pachelbel; and Dieterich Buxtehude.
item.dc:creator: Sears, Ralph
item.dc:subject: Purcell, Henry, 1659-1695

item.title: Pre-Baroque and Baroque organ music, part two
item.description: This program focuses on the organ compositions of Henry Purcell and Dieterich Buxtehude.

item.dc:subject: Purcell, Henry, 1659-1695

item.description: The first of several programs looking at Pre-Baroque and Baroque organ music features discussion and performance of organ compositions by Marcello, Sweelinck, Walther, and Pachelbel.

item.dc:subject: Sweelinck, Jan Pieterszoon, 1562-1621. Organ music
